thread.title: Sabres beat Maple Leafs in shootout
thread.title_full: Sabres beat Maple Leafs in shootout

author: Nick Mendola
title: Sabres beat Maple Leafs in shootout
text:
Buffalo Sabres left wing Matt Moulson (26) scores the winning goal against Toronto Maple Leafs goalie Jonathan Bernier (45) during the shootout at First Niagara Center. (Kevin Hoffman/USA Today Sports) Sabres beat Maple Leafs in shootout Nick Mendola BUFFALO, N.Y. â€” The Associated Press 
Published Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 10:35PM EDT 
Last updated Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 10:37PM EDT 
Evander Kane tied it with 4:29 left with his first goal for Buffalo and the Sabres beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 2-1 in a shootout Wednesday night. 
Matt Moulson and Tyler Ennis scored in the shootout, while Chad Johnson made 23 saves as Buffalo improved to 2-4. 
P.A. Parenteau scored and Jonathan Bernier made 34 saves as the Maple Leafs fell to 1-3-2. Never miss out
